posts.post_content:
I have a raw T206  Mathewson dark cap that I picked up at a show last weekend.  I intend to resell the card and figured I'd post this here instead of trying advertise a sale on the main board.  Anyway, the card would would grade EX-ish except for some minor paper loss which I understand will have a significant impact on the grade.    It appears to measure correctly, but I'm by no means an expert.  So should I get it graded or sell it as is?
[IMG]http://home.roadrunner.com/~jevintage/IMG1.jpg[/IMG]
[IMG]http://home.roadrunner.com/~jevintage/IMG2.jpg[/IMG]

[quote name="effe" post=1002634]I have a raw T206  Mathewson dark cap that I picked up at a show last weekend.  I intend to resell the card and figured I'd post this here instead of trying advertise a sale on the main board.  Anyway, the card would would grade EX-ish except for some minor paper loss which I understand will have a significant impact on the grade.    It appears to measure correctly, but I'm by no means an expert.  So should I get it graded or sell it as is?[/QUOTE]

For resale I would probably get it graded. You have to figure for a $15 grading fee (or so), will that be made up in a higher sale price by more than the amount to grade it. If yes then grade it, if no then don't.
